subject: Business
title: Managing Anger at the Table
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Managing Anger at the Table.

hook.text: The other side insults your proposal. Your face flushes. You want to fire back. Don't.

buildup.text: Anger narrows thinking and turns negotiations into fights. Nobody makes good deals when they're furious.

discovery.text: Strategic anger can be manufactured. But genuine anger almost always hurts the angry party more.

twist.text: Some negotiators provoke anger deliberately. Recognizing the tactic is the first step to neutralizing it.

climax.text: When provoked, slow down. 'Let me take a moment to consider that' buys time and lowers the temperature.

punchline.text: The person who stays calm controls the room.

quiz.question: Why do some negotiators deliberately provoke anger?
options: Angry people make worse decisions and give up more
Angry people are more creative problem-solvers
